messages.message: Hey @Ashish, sorry for missing this - I will follow up by EOD!

Hey Ashish, so we have the tiers defined at a high level here (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1kVOZW0TE8tZeLRLB5mDVpAz3s7mGskGRtHjkWoTPhpE/edit) - this doc is a bit dated, but the overall tiers are still applicable (small - 64cpu/192gb, medium - 128cpu/512gb, large 256cpu/1tb, anything larger is generally custom to the instance or workload).

We have the same in control plane, where the installer supports standard, large, extra-large deployments (which map to small, medium, large - but calling it standard instead of small looked better for customers :stuck_out_tongue: ). These apply a standard set of resource configuration for each size bucket, but we'll need to rework these a bit based on learnings from this weekend.

The current sandbox provisioning (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1dG3TA07-_64pKYLtvWStt-8aLLMwCeeTzmXDjlpw4hs/edit#gid=1542399463) represents the 'small' size well. Prod (https://console.cloud.google.com/kubernetes/workload/overview?project=instabase-main&pageState=(%22savedViews%22:(%22i%22:%2271c1e8cc9080466992bbf6987874a286%22,%22c%22:%5B%22gke%2Fus-central1-c%2Finstabase-main-prod-002%22%5D,%22n%22:%5B%22instabase-prod%22%5D))) is currently running close to a 'medium' size.
Let me know what you are thinking about for SaaS, would love to work together on the provisioning as well!
Thanks Kunal! I'll review and get back to you
